channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8405] Add more custom options to how ClusterManager runs commands
item.description: You may want to run yet more custom commands (such as su as some local user) depending on test setup.
item.summary: Add more custom options to how ClusterManager runs commands

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Seems good enough, but I think doing it in HBaseCommandProvider would be more clean. CommandProvider looks like a better place to do su, rather than ssh, since ssh is just SSH specific. I would be ok with this as well though, not that big of a deal.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12580146/HBASE-8405-v0.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5413//testReport/

This message is automatically generated.

The scenario this is intended for essentially makes it part of transport, not a logical command... you get to machine, you do something like assume user identity, then run logical command. So it's closer to transport than to command provider imho.

Technically su is a command we run after we are done with SSH, and has nothing to do with the transport. But it is not that big of a deal really as long as it is documented. I'm +1 if you also add a single sentence about this param in the book.

Updated a doc. It has everything to do with transport if you consider transport done when we are ready to run the remote command It has nothing to do with logical command though. Later we can add another layer, but I don't think it's necessary.
+1 on commit.

not flexuble enough 0_o
I will provide alternative patch today or monday-ish
Sergey, can you instead close this and open another one. Less confusion that way.
I think it should be alright in this jira... I am superseding the current patch here completely
here's the patch

2 comments.

Some system might not be using bash but a different command line interpreter. Should we make that configurable? Or since all the hbase scripts are for bash too, it's ok to hard code it? Same question for the SSH path.

2 comments.

Some system might not be using bash but a different command line interpreter. Should we make that configurable? Or since all the hbase scripts are for bash too, it's ok to hard code it? Same question for the SSH path.

That was indeed two comments

Not sure about these. The actual logical commands currently use bunch of POSIX commands, that may or may not be portable. I don't think there's value in making these configurable. Although hypothetically you could run the test on Windows with ssh and remote machines running Linux and thus succeeding in the remote command, I don't know if it will work.
SSH - will remove path probably, let me ask Enis for original intent
SSH path is now configurable, I think the default makes sense.
I will commit later today by default
94 patch, the same changes
